segments.en: Linked Discourses 4
2. Rule
18. Alms Food

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā magadhesu viharati pañcasālāyaṃ brāhmaṇagāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the brahmin village of Pañcasālā.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pañcasālāyaṃ brāhmaṇagāme kumārikānaṃ pāhunakāni bhavanti.
segments.en: Now at that time in Pañcasālā the young women were taking care of guests.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya pañcasālaṃ brāhmaṇagāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Pañcasālā for alms.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pañcasāleyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā mārena pāpimatā anvāviṭṭhā bhavanti:
segments.en: Now at that time Māra had possessed the brahmins and householders of Pañcasālā, so that they thought,
“Don’t let the ascetic Gotama get any alms!”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yathādhotena pattena pañcasālaṃ brāhmaṇagāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi tathādhotena pattena paṭikkami.
segments.en: Then the Buddha left the village with his bowl as clean-washed as it was when he entered for alms.

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and said to him,
“Well, ascetic, did you get any alms?”

segments.pli: “Tathā nu tvaṃ, pāpima, akāsi yathāhaṃ piṇḍaṃ na labheyyan”ti.
segments.en: “Wicked One, did you make sure I didn’t get any alms?”

segments.pli: “Tena hi, bhante, bhagavā dutiyampi pañcasālaṃ brāhmaṇagāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisatu.
segments.en: “Well then, sir, let the Buddha enter Pañcasālā a second time for alms.

segments.pli: Tathāhaṃ karissāmi yathā bhagavā piṇḍaṃ lacchatī”ti.
segments.en: I’ll make sure you get alms.”
“Māra’s made bad karma
in attacking the Realized One.
Wicked One, do you imagine that
your wickedness won’t bear fruit?
We who have nothing
live so very happily.
We’ll feed on rapture,
like the gods of streaming radiance.”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṃ bhagavā, jānāti maṃ sugato”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
